question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you provide is executable whenever possible.
Please help me implement the following requirement using code. Create a close-up of a basketball featuring the New York Knicks logo using SVG code.

checklist.title: Is the basketball shape accurately implemented in SVG?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code properly implements a realistic basketball sphere using SVG elements. The basketball should have the correct proportions (close to a circle), appropriate fill color (orange/brown), and proper depth perception. Deduct 5 points if the basketball shape lacks dimensional quality, 3 points if the proportions are incorrect, and 2 points if the coloring is unrealistic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the basketball texture lines/seams accurately rendered?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG code includes the characteristic curved lines/seams of a basketball. A standard basketball has 8 seams forming curved panels. Verify that these lines are properly positioned, have appropriate curvature, and realistic width/color. Give 10 points for anatomically correct seam patterns with proper spacing and curvature, 5 points if basic lines are present but improperly positioned, and 0 points if seams are missing entirely.

checklist.title: Is the New York Knicks logo properly implemented and positioned?
checklist.description: Assess whether the New York Knicks logo is accurately reproduced with correct proportions, colors (blue, orange, and white/gray), and details. The official logo includes the team name 'KNICKS' above a basketball with 'NEW YORK' text. Verify proper positioning on the basketball surface with appropriate perspective distortion if needed. Award 10 points for an accurate logo with all elements, 5 points for a simplified but recognizable version, and 0 points if the logo is unrecognizable or missing key elements.

checklist.title: Is the close-up perspective effectively achieved?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the SVG successfully creates a close-up view of the basketball. This may involve techniques like partial visibility of the ball, detail enhancement, potential shadow/highlight effects to emphasize proximity, or other perspective techniques. Give 10 points for convincing close-up rendering with appropriate depth cues, 5 points if the perspective is present but not convincing, and 3 points if the image appears flat with no close-up qualities.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is structured to display correctly across different browsers and viewports. Check for properly defined viewBox, preserveAspectRatio attributes, and responsive design considerations. Code with strong robustness should use relative units where appropriate and include fallback options. Give 10 points for fully responsive SVG that maintains proportions across viewports, 5 points for functional but fixed-size implementation, and 0 points if the SVG breaks in common scenarios.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visual (e.g., 1. Subtle animation like a spinning ball 2. Interactive elements like hover effects 3. Realistic texture/lighting effects like specular highlights). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessarily complex paths that could be simplified 2. Duplicate elements that serve the same visual purpose 3. Excessive detail that impacts performance without visual benefit. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visualization is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as logical grouping of SVG elements), proper naming of IDs/classes, and reuse of common elements through <defs> or similar techniques. Deduct 5 points if elements are not logically grouped; deduct 5 points if there's excessive repetition of similar path definitions; deduct 5 points if no comments or organizational structure exists. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual representation meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Accurate brand color usage according to NY Knicks official colors 2) Proper proportions and visual balance 3) Appropriate level of detail for an SVG illustration. Deduct 3 points for each color inaccuracy, 5 points for poor proportions, and 5 points for inappropriate detail level (either too simplistic or unnecessarily complex). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG optimized for performance and compatibility?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG is efficiently implemented: 1) Paths are optimized without unnecessary points 2) Appropriate use of SVG primitive shapes where possible instead of complex paths 3) Reasonable file size without bloat. Deduct 5 points for unoptimized paths with excessive points, 3 points for using complex paths where simple primitives would suffice, and 5 points for unnecessarily large file size due to poor optimization. The full score is 10 points.
